text: How do you resize the entire canvas in MS Paint?

options.text: Go to the Home tab and select Resize.

explanation: The Resize option in the Home tab allows you to adjust the dimensions of the entire canvas.

text: What does skewing an image in MS Paint do?

options.text: It tilts the image horizontally or vertically.

explanation: Skewing, available in the Resize dialog, tilts the image along the horizontal or vertical axis.

text: How do you flip the entire canvas vertically in MS Paint?

options.text: Select Rotate > Flip vertical from the Home tab.

explanation: The Flip vertical option under Rotate in the Home tab mirrors the entire canvas top to bottom.

text: What is the effect of applying transparency to a selection in MS Paint?

options.text: It makes the background color of the selection transparent.
It inverts the colors of the selection.

explanation: Enabling transparency in the Select tool makes the background color (Color 2) transparent when pasting.

text: How do you undo an action in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+Z undoes the most recent action, allowing you to revert changes.

text: What does the Redo command do in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+Y or the Redo command reapplies an action that was previously undone.

text: How can you rotate an image 180 degrees in MS Paint?

options.text: Select Rotate > Rotate 180 from the Home tab.

explanation: The Rotate 180 option in the Home tab rotates the entire image or selection 180 degrees.

text: What happens when you crop an image in MS Paint?

options.text: The canvas is reduced to the selected area.

explanation: Cropping reduces the canvas to the boundaries of the selected area, removing everything outside it.

text: How do you enable transparency for a pasted selection?

options.text: Check the Transparent selection option in the Select menu.

explanation: The Transparent selection option in the Select menu makes the background color transparent when pasting.

text: What is a limitation of resizing images in MS Paint?

options.text: Resizing may cause pixelation or loss of quality.
Resizing is not possible in MS Paint.
Resizing only works for selections, not the entire canvas.

explanation: Resizing in MS Paint, especially enlarging, can cause pixelation due to the lack of advanced interpolation algorithms.

text: Which file format in MS Paint preserves image quality without compression?
explanation: PNG is a lossless format that preserves image quality without compression, unlike JPEG, which is lossy.

text: What is a disadvantage of saving an image as a JPEG in MS Paint?

options.text: It may lose quality due to compression.
It cannot be opened in other programs.

explanation: JPEG is a lossy format, meaning it compresses the image, potentially reducing quality, especially with repeated saves.

text: How do you open an existing image in MS Paint?

options.text: Go to File > Open and select the image.
Select Paste from the Home tab.

explanation: The File > Open option allows you to browse and select an existing image to edit in MS Paint.

text: How can you set the canvas size in MS Paint?

options.text: Go to File > Properties and adjust dimensions.

explanation: File > Properties allows you to set the canvas size by specifying width and height in pixels.

text: What is the default file format when saving a new image in MS Paint?
explanation: In modern versions of MS Paint, the default save format is PNG due to its lossless quality and transparency support.

text: How do you export an image for printing in MS Paint?

options.text: Select Copy from the Home tab.

explanation: File > Print sends the image to a connected printer, allowing you to configure print settings.

text: Which file format in MS Paint supports transparency?
explanation: PNG supports transparency, making it ideal for images with transparent backgrounds, unlike JPEG or BMP.

text: What happens if you save an image in BMP format in MS Paint?

options.text: The file size is typically larger than PNG or JPEG.

explanation: BMP is an uncompressed format, resulting in larger file sizes compared to compressed formats like PNG or JPEG.

text: How do you import an image into an existing canvas in MS Paint?

options.text: Use Paste From under the Paste menu.

explanation: Paste From in the Paste menu allows you to import an image from a file into the current canvas.

text: What is the purpose of the Properties dialog in MS Paint?

options.text: To set canvas dimensions and units.
To apply filters to the image.

explanation: The Properties dialog (File > Properties) allows users to set the canvas size and choose units like pixels or inches.

text: What is the keyboard shortcut for the Eraser tool in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+E selects the Eraser tool, allowing you to erase parts of the canvas with the background color.

text: Which shortcut is used to undo an action in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+Z undoes the most recent action, reverting changes made to the canvas.

text: What does the Ctrl+Y shortcut do in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+Y redoes an action that was previously undone, restoring it to the canvas.

text: Which shortcut zooms in on the canvas in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+Plus zooms in, increasing the magnification of the canvas for detailed editing.

text: What is the shortcut for copying a selection in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+C copies the selected area to the clipboard for pasting elsewhere.

text: Which shortcut pastes a copied selection in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+V pastes the contents of the clipboard onto the canvas.

text: What is the shortcut for saving an image in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+S opens the Save or Save As dialog to save the image to a file.

text: Which shortcut opens a new canvas in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+N creates a new blank canvas in MS Paint.

text: What does the Ctrl+Minus shortcut do in MS Paint?

options.text: It zooms out of the canvas.
It zooms in on the canvas.

explanation: Ctrl+Minus zooms out, reducing the magnification of the canvas.

text: Which shortcut selects the Text tool in MS Paint?
explanation: Ctrl+T activates the Text tool, allowing you to add text to the canvas.

text: How can MS Paint be used to create a simple flowchart?

options.text: Use shapes like rectangles and arrows to represent steps and connections.
Use the Crop tool to create flowchart symbols.
Use the Color Picker to draw flowchart lines.
Use the Zoom tool to align shapes.

explanation: Shapes like rectangles, ovals, and arrows, combined with the Text tool, can be used to create flowchart diagrams in MS Paint.

text: What is a common use of MS Paint for editing screenshots?

options.text: Adding annotations with text and shapes.

explanation: MS Paint is often used to annotate screenshots with text, arrows, or shapes to highlight or explain content.

text: How can MS Paint be used to design a basic logo?

options.text: Combine shapes, text, and colors to create a simple design.
Use the Crop tool to create logo shapes.
Apply transparency to the entire canvas.
Use the Zoom tool to draw logos.

explanation: MS Paint’s shapes, text, and color tools allow users to create simple logos by combining basic elements.

text: What is a key step in combining multiple images in MS Paint?

options.text: Use Paste From to import images and arrange them on the canvas.
Use the Crop tool to merge images.
Use the Eraser to blend images.
Use the Zoom tool to align images.

explanation: The Paste From option allows users to import multiple images, which can then be moved and arranged on the canvas.

text: How is MS Paint suitable for pixel art creation?

options.text: Its grid and zoom features allow precise pixel-by-pixel drawing.
It supports advanced layering for pixel art.

explanation: MS Paint’s gridlines and zoom functionality make it ideal for precise pixel art creation, allowing detailed control over individual pixels.

text: What is a common issue when resizing the canvas in MS Paint?

options.text: Accidentally cropping content if the new size is too small.

explanation: Resizing the canvas to a smaller size may crop content outside the new boundaries, so users must ensure important content is preserved.

text: What is a key limitation of MS Paint compared to advanced tools like Photoshop?
explanation: MS Paint does not support layers, making it harder to edit complex images compared to tools like Photoshop.

text: How can pixelation occur when resizing images in MS Paint?

options.text: Enlarging an image stretches pixels, causing a blocky appearance.
Reducing the image size adds transparency.

explanation: Enlarging an image in MS Paint stretches existing pixels, leading to a blocky, pixelated appearance due to the lack of advanced scaling algorithms.

text: What can you do to recover unsaved work after MS Paint crashes?

options.text: MS Paint does not have an autosave feature, so recovery is not possible.
Use Ctrl+R to recover the file.

explanation: MS Paint lacks an autosave or recovery feature, so unsaved work is typically lost after a crash.

text: What is a challenge when working with large image files in MS Paint?

options.text: MS Paint may run slowly or crash due to limited processing power.
Large files cannot be opened in MS Paint.

explanation: MS Paint is not optimized for large image files, which can cause performance issues like slow operation or crashes.
